issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Fix merge to work in presence of AST rewrites

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Fail UPDATE/DELETE/MERGE queries when Ranger authorization manager is used

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Currently ACID UpdateDeleteSemanticAnalyzer directly manipulates the AST tree but it's different from the general approach of modifying the token stream and thus will cause AST tree mismatch if there is any rewrite happening after UpdateDeleteSemanticAnalyzer.

The long term solution will be to rewrite the AST handling logic in UpdateDeleteSemanticAnalyzer, to make it consistent with the general approach.

This ticket will for now detect the error prone cases and fail early.
fields.summary: Detect query rewrite scenario for UPDATE/DELETE/MERGE and fail fast

ATTACHMENT ID: 12853161 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Test failures not related. [~ekoifman] Can you take a look please?

delete from acidTable where acidTable.t in (select a from nonAcidTable).

suppose there is column masking or row-filtering on nonAcidTable but not on acidTable - will you still throw?
Yes it will. I can add another test for that.
I would argue that it should not...

I think it should, because as long as query involves update operations on acid table we have no guarantee how the AST will be after the rewrite. So we should throw the error. Current row filtering implementation has a vague distinction of "not supporting acid". I think this should fall in the "unsupported" category for now, until the AST manipulation is consistent.
